elements.content: Multifunctional sensing ability of a new Pt/Zn-based luminescent coordination polymer†polymerAtsushi KobayashiHirofumi HaraShin-ichiro Noro and Masako Katopolymer5,5′-dicarboxy-2,2′-bipyridineresponse tosolventsIIThermogravimetric analysiswateradsorption measurementswaterwaterIIEmission spectraIR spectroscopypowder X-ray diffractionwateradsorption/desorptionIIII1–21IIII23IIgroupsII45IIIIchromophorehydrogen4,5polymers67solventswaterdecompositionsolventspolymers4,4′-dicarboxy-2,2′-bipyridinegroups84H25,5′-dicarboxy-2,2′-bipyridineresponse topolymersynchrotrongroupcyano groupswater8waterhydrogenwatercyano groupWaterIIchromophore4,5waterwaterTGDTATG-DTAwaterwaterwatermethanolwaterwaterwaterwaterporeswaterIImethanolwaterpore(a) Perspective view of the unit cell of 1·4H2O along b axis. (b) One-dimensional chain structure of 1. Dotted lines show the hydrogen bonds. (c) Stacked structure with metallophilic interaction of 1. Pt, Zn, C, N and O atoms are indicated as blue, green, dark brown, light blue and red filled circles, respectively. Blue plates show the coordination environments of Pt, and green octahedrons show those of the Zn ions. The disordered O8 atom and H atoms are omitted for clarity.16

(a) Perspective view of the unit cell of 1⋅4H2O along b axis. (b) One-dimensional chain structure of 1. Dotted lines show the hydrogen bonds. (c) Stacked structure with metallophilic interaction of 1. Pt, Zn, C, N and O atoms are indicated as blue, green, dark brown, light blue and red filled circles, respectively. Blue plates show the coordination environments of Pt, and green octahedrons show those of the Zn ions. The disordered O8 atom and H atoms are omitted for clarity.16

elements.content: emission spectrumacetonitrilewaterreflectance spectracrystallographic data‡ Crystal data of 1·4H2O: {Zn[Pt(CN)2(5,5′-dcbpy)]·4H2O}n, T = 90(1) K, P21/m (#11), a = 9.495(17) Å, b = 6.577(11) Å, c = 14.10(2) Å, β = 101.38(3)°, V = 864(3) Å3, Z = 2, μ(Mo-Kα) = 9.419 mm−1, Dc.= 2.410 g cm−3, Rint = 0.112. No. of collected and unique reflections were 9503 and 3055, respectively. The final R1 and wR(F2) were 0.0771 and 0.2292 (I > 2σ), respectively.
